messages.content:
The first message I sent you is my resume. Every other message will be a job description. Based on the job description and my resume, please give me a five sentences email that I can send to the recruiter that quickly explains my interest and qualifications. 


Example Prompt:

Data Engineer
at PrizePicks
Remote
At PrizePicks, we are the fastest growing sports company in North America, as recognized by Inc. 5000.  As the leading platform for Daily Fantasy Sports, we cover a diverse range of sports leagues, including the NFL, NBA, and Esports titles like League of Legends and CS:GO.  Our team of over 200 employees thrives in an inclusive culture that values individuals from diverse backgrounds, regardless of their level of sports fandom.  Ready to reimagine the DFS industry together? 

Our Analytics Team is responsible for building and maintaining analytics tools and workflows to support the PrizePicks business. By developing, maintaining, and testing data generation infrastructures, you will enable the PrizePicks business to make smarter, better, and faster data-driven decisions. 

What you’ll do:

Create, maintain and orchestrate optimal data pipeline architecture 
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. 
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources. 
Improve and streamline data systems to drive innovation within Prizepicks
What you have:

3+ years of experience building frameworks for data ingestion pipelines but real time and batch using data modeling, ETL/ELT processes 
Stellar SQL skills, experience building DBT pipelines in production and know your way around structured, semi-structured and unstructured data. 
Have built and optimized ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets. 
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. 
Experience with Python and other object oriented scripting languages
Cloud experience: AWS, EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift, GCP, etc.. 
Not required but would be awesome if you have experience with any of the following data pipeline and workflow tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Prefect, etc.

Example Response:

Subject - Python Data Engineer (F/T - Direct-hire only)


Hello, 

Hope you are doing well. 

I urgently need to secure employment. I firmly believe that my desire to contribute, combined with my relevant skills and deep love for sports, positions make me a strong candidate for the Python Data Engineer role. As an ardent sports enthusiast, with a particular passion for French soccer, and an experienced Data Analyst with a strong command of Python and SQL, this position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to a domain I greatly value.

Best regards,

Earl Chase III

Earl Nathaniel Chase III
Brooklyn, NY | 713.517.1301 | echase3@gmail.com  


TRADING OPERATIONS ANALYST
Adaptable Trading Operations Analyst with extensive experience in managing the post-trade life cycle and driving operational efficiency. Strong expertise in risk management, trading execution, and account reconciliation. Proficient in using Python for developing automation solutions to streamline processes and improve accuracy. Trusted by management for navigating complex regulatory environments and ensuring adherence to industry standards. 


AREAS OF EXPERTISE
Operations | Python | Regulatory Compliance |Trading | Capital Markets | Quantitative Analysis | Problem-Solving


PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Milliman, Chicago, IL	July 2022 - March 2023
Milliman is an independent risk management, benefits, and technology firm with offices in major cities around the globe.
Trading Operations Analyst   |   Remote
Actively supported trade desk, portfolio management team, and actuaries in all aspects of the post-trade life cycle, including trade execution, risk management, and account reconciliation.

Designed and implemented a dashboard in MS Access using SQL of daily OTC trades across all client accounts in order to ensure accurate record-keeping. 
Created and maintained Python scripts used to send and receive trade data received from clients and brokers via FTP.
Utilized Python to create automated emails and responses for our clients’ daily options settlements and daily variation margin requirements, ensuring timely and accurate responses to all inquiries.
Collaborated with the trading team and technologists to ensure the prompt resolution of breaks. 

Wells Fargo Securities, Minneapolis, MN 	August 2020 - February 2022
Financial services company and leading middle-market banking provider in the United States.
Capital Markets Institutional Operations Support Analyst
Provided operational support to the Treasury Cash Management group to ensure timely, accurate and compliant processing of wire transfers and ACH transactions used for trade settlements. 


Developed Excel VBA macros used to process and upload over 100 wire transactions, totaling $1 Billion+ daily,  to Swift for internal and external safekeeping and prime customers.
Used Nexen and Broadridge to reconcile cash balances of client accounts as well as accounts held by the cash management team.
Used Python to create a simple dashboard that measured the wire volume and the productivity of the six desks managed by the team.
Collaborated with WFSE and WFSIL to ensure the proper segregation of foreign currency accounts and adherence to regulatory requirements.
Monitored client and bank accounts to identify irregular activity and swiftly responded to any issues including resolving breaks and any other irregular activity. 

L'Équipe de Recherche en Epidemiologie Nutritionnelle (EREN), Paris, France         October 2019 - March 2021
University of Paris research team in Nutritional Epidemiology.
Research Intern
Explored objectives, methods, results, and conclusions through scientific research, writing, and presentations.


Co-authored “Modelling the number of avoidable new cancer cases in France attributable to alcohol consumption by following public health recommendations”.  
Conducted a literature review on the relationship between cancer and the consumption of alcohol.
Researched different methods used by governments to limit alcohol consumption.
Aided in the creation of a model that will estimate the effects of price and other political constraints on alcohol and their subsequent effects on alcohol-related cancers.


Dominium, Plymouth, MN	May 2019 - August 2019
Dominium is one of the nation’s most innovative affordable housing development and management companies.
Development & Acquisitions Intern
Assisted the analysts, associates, developers, and project partners with all aspects of the real estate development process. 


Conducted, interpreted, and presented market research during the project feasibility stage.
Identified prospective sites for multi-family developments.
Assisted in the completion of Federal Home Loan Bank loan applications.
Contributed to the creation of pro-forma and discounted cash flow models in Excel.


EDUCATION
Bachelor of Arts (BA)
Macalester College, Saint Paul, MN


TECHNICAL SKILLS
 Python | SQL |VBA | VBS | Advanced Excel | Bash

Product Operations at Valon

The Product Operations team makes it possible for Valon to build, scale, and continuously improve our product and operations at a rapid pace. They work closely with teams like Product, Engineering, Compliance, Legal, Client Experience, and Servicing Operations to develop our operational processes for both new and existing products. As a member of this team, you will use your skills to gather business requirements, advance operational excellence across our business, and fulfill Valon’s mission of creating a great user experience for homeowners.

About the Role

We’re looking for a driven and detail-oriented individual who is passionate about building business operations from the ground up and has a proven track record of meeting business objectives in a fast-paced, rapidly-evolving environment. The right candidate must be adept at working cross-functionally to tackle complex business problems and be proficient in applying structured problem-solving methodologies and frameworks. They must have a history of taking the initiative to see projects through to completion and be able to independently drive operational excellence for our business.

Responsibilities
Build business operations for the Default Servicing team in collaboration with Product, Engineering, Legal and Compliance, and Servicing Operations teams
Research business requirements for new processes and translate them into day-to-day standard operating procedures
Develop resources for new products, processes, and features (project plans, standard operating procedures, FAQs, etc.) and train Servicing Operations teams in partnership with the Operations Enablement team
Act as an advocate for the Servicing Operations teams, and help inform product development and prioritization to fit their needs
Leverage qualitative and quantitative data to continuously improve existing products and processes for operations stakeholders
Work with the Client Experience, Servicing Operations, Compliance, and Quality Management teams to ensure operational excellence and efficiency
Manage operations incidents or loan-level escalations and serve as a stop gap support system for Servicing Operations as needed
Learn new concepts and technologies quickly and apply them to complex challenges
Cultivate a deep understanding of the mortgage servicing industry
Ideal Background
2-4 years experience working in program or project management, product operations, consulting, or business operations role
Prior experience working collaboratively with product managers, engineers, and operations to develop new products or complex processes
Strong project management skills with an ability to prioritize, communicate progress, and deliver results while managing multiple projects
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with experience in effective stakeholder management
Extremely self-motivated and results-oriented — is organized, proactive in finding solutions, and has a strong drive to complete projects
Able to remain calm under pressure, and can excel under time-sensitive deadlines while maintaining a positive attitude
Embraces opportunities for growth, and is competent in working both independently and as part of a high-velocity team
Excel and Google Sheets skills required, Looker / SQL experience preferred
Experience in mortgage origination, mortgage servicing, or in the real estate industry is a plus

Subject: Enthusiastic Trading Operations Analyst Seeking Product Operations Role at Valon

Dear Valon’s Hiring Team,

I am writing to express my interest in your Product Operations role. With a background as a Trading Operations Analyst, managing complex regulatory environments and improving operational efficiency through Python-based automation, I believe my skills reflect your needs. I have gained significant experience collaborating across functions and problem-solving in high-pressure environments at Milliman and Wells Fargo Securities to deliver precise, data-driven results. 

I would appreciate the opportunity to contribute my skills, dedication, and passion for cross-functional problem-solving to Valon, and look forward to discussing how I can positively impact your Servicing Operations Team.

Best regards,

Earl Chase III
